greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Third level generalization of Catalan triangle (0th level is Pascal's triangle A007318; first level is Catalan triangle A009766; 2nd level is A069269).
comment: For the m-th level generalization of Catalan triangle T(n,k) = C(n+mk,k)*(n-k+1)/(n+(m-1)k+1); for n >= k+m: T(n,k) = T(n-m+1,k+1) - T(n-m,k+1); and T(n,n) = T(n+m-1,n-1) = C((m+1)n,n)/(mn+1).
Antidiagonals of convolution matrix of Table 1.5, p. 397, of Hoggatt and Bicknell. - _Tom Copeland_, Dec 25 2019
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..11475 (rows 0 <= n <= 150, flattened.)
V. E. Hoggatt, Jr. and M. Bicknell, Catalan and related sequences arising from inverses of Pascal's triangle matrices, Fib. Quart., 14 (1976), 395-405.
mathematica: Table[Binomial[n + 3 k, k] (n - k + 1)/(n + 2 k + 1), {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 27 2019 *)
xref: Columns include A000012, A000027, A055999. Righthand columns include A002293, A069271, A006632, A002293 (without first 1). A130458 (row sums).
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 12 2002
